references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a vision-language model that is foundational to the proposed PartCLIPSeg method, enabling zero-shot capabilities.
This is a seminal paper in open-vocabulary semantic segmentation, which provides a strong basis for the development of open-vocabulary part segmentation methods.

references.paper_title: Detect what you can: Detecting and representing objects using holistic models and body parts
references.reason: This paper introduces the Pascal-Part dataset, which is a key dataset used for evaluating the proposed PartCLIPSeg model.
The CLIPSeg architecture forms the basis for PartCLIPSeg, providing a strong foundation for incorporating object-level and part-level context.

references.paper_title: PartImageNet: A large, high-quality dataset of parts
references.reason: This paper introduces the PartImageNet dataset, another key dataset used for evaluating the proposed PartCLIPSeg model.
